alert.note: Alert for North St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 9:28AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern St. Louis County through 945 AM CDT... At 927 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over northwestern Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, or 26 miles north of Ely, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern St. Louis County, including the following locations... Lac la Croix, Lake Agnes, Crooked Lake and Loon Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Anyone at a campground should seek sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
